intro: Boehmeria lateriflora, commonly known as Chinese nettle or wild hemp, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Its fibers are used in traditional textiles and papermaking, highlighting its economic and cultural significance. Boehmeria lateriflora also serves as a host plant for certain butterfly species, contributing to local biodiversity.
